item.title: Entrance to 66 queens crescent, 13th January
item.description:
After the resurfacing works on queens crescent, the pavement has not been finished at the correct height to the shop front entrance, creating a trip hazard. There appears to be a section that has been laid on top of the finished tarmac to bring it level, but as it’s not been keyed into the existing floor it is fraying away. We are planning to reopen the store on the 24th of January and would need the works completed before then as it would be a trip hazard for the public
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bassett Street, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Glass falling on pavement and at entrance to premises, 13th January
item.description:
There is glass falling from the badly repaired broken window. Landlord (GHL (Eagle Wharf) Ltd) has been informed of the breakage regularly for the last 12 months and has taken no action to reduce the risk to public safety.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eagle Wharf Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streets not being cleaned, Hazel Lane and Hawthorne Crescent, 13th January
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, Can you please arrange street cleaners to Hawthorne Crescent and Hazel Lane (SE 10 9GA), as there is a ton of litter strewn all over the streets. This only allowed me to upload 3 pictures but I had actually taken many more.... The problem does not seem to affect Woolwich Rd, Trafalgar Road or Tunnel Ave. So, it seems that Hawthorne Crescent and Hazel Lane do not get cleaned when the surrounding are cleaned. Hawthorne Crescent and Hazel Lane seem are constantly full of rubbish. e.g. bottles, shirts, condom wrappers, face masks, papers, crisp packets, etc. found just today. This is foul and unacceptable in a family area, where we pay council taxes. e.g. in our house there are 2 under 10 year old children. Most of our neighbours also have small children. Can you please: 1. Arrange a cleaning team to visit asap? 2. Ensure that they visit on a regular basis? Thank you in advance, Markus Coleman (Resident at 101 Hawhorne Crescent)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hawthorne Crescent, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
